main event: Two oval-shaped objects, smaller than a basketball, were observed traveling east to west at an estimated speed of 300-400 mph near Xenia, Ohio on November 18, 1956.
interesting points: The objects were reported to have a bright orange-red glow, much brighter than a star, and appeared to change altitude and shape slightly.
The objects made high-pitched mechanical sounds, not like a jet engine, and displayed various colored lights.
The objects were estimated to be 30-40 feet in diameter and maneuvered in a zig-zag pattern at an altitude higher than 5,000 feet.
The witness was driving along a highway when the objects came into view and appeared to move in an unusual manner.
The Air Force explained that the sighting was likely due to weather balloon tests being conducted in the area, with red lights attached to the balloons.
sighted object: two oval-shaped objects with bright orange-red glow
